intro: Scutellaria cypria, commonly known as Cyprus skullcap, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Scutellaria cypria is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
